introduction: Nephrolepis exaltata, known as the sword fern[1] or Boston fern, is a species of fern in the family Nephrolepidaceae.[3] It is native to the Americas.[1] This evergreen plant can reach as high as 4090 centimetres (1635 in), and in extreme cases up to 1.5 metres (4 ft 11 in). It is also known as the Boston sword fern, wild Boston fern, Boston blue bell fern, tuber ladder fern, or fishbone fern.[4]
